docs.title: Basic Information
docs.text:
This is Tatsuhiro Tsuchiya's webpage.

  • Name: Tatsuhiro Tsuchiya (First/Last)
  • Affiliation: Department of Information Systems Engineering Graduate School of Information Science and Technology Osaka University
  • Title: Professor

docs.title: For students interested in joining our lab from abroad (excluding exchange programs, such as FrontierLab)
docs.text: Please contact Admissions Assistance Desk (AAD), instead of contacting me directly. I do not reply to direct messages.

docs.title: Biography
docs.text: I am currently a professor of the Department of Information Systems Engineering at Osaka University. I received the M.E. and Ph.D. degrees from Osaka University in 1995 and 1998, respectively. My research interests are in the areas of model checking, software testing, and distributed fault-tolerant systems.

docs.title: Puzzles
docs.text:
Please open these sites in separate tabs.

  • Let's construct covering arrays.
  • Let's locate faulty interactions.

docs.title: Programs
docs.text:
• CIT-BACH: Combinatorial Interaction Testing tool with a BDD-Assisted Constraint Handler
  • Bool2CNF: Tseytin transformation tool
  • KTK: A tool for constructing pair-wise covering arrays
  • Bounded model checker for Petri nets

For other miscellaneous programs, visit my github page.

docs.title: Dependable Systems
docs.text: Tomohiro Yoneda, Seiji Kajihara, and Tatsuhiro Tsuchiya, Dependable Systems, ISBN: 978-4320121522, Kyoritsu Shuppan, Tokyo, 2005. (Japanese)

docs.title: A Gentle Introduction to Computer Algorithms
docs.text: Tatsuhiro Tsuchiya, A Gentle Introduction to Computer Algorithms, ISBN: 978-4320122444, Kyoritsu Shuppan, Tokyo, 2009. (Japanese)
